meanings.definition: To strain to excess or beyond the normal limit.
meanings.sent1: I overstrain my muscles when I lift heavy weights.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overstrain herself by taking on too many tasks at once.
meanings.sent3: The elastic band decided to overstrain itself just for fun.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed made him overstrain his capabilities.
meanings.sent5: The bridge collapsed under the overstrain of the heavy trucks passing over it.

meanings.definition: The act of straining to excess or beyond the normal limit.
meanings.sent1: Overstrain can lead to muscle injuries if not careful.
meanings.sent2: The overstrain on the rope caused it to snap suddenly.
meanings.sent3: The overstrain of the balloon made it pop with a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The overstrain on the team's resources was evident during the project.
meanings.sent5: The overstrain on her voice from shouting caused her to lose it temporarily.
